page.title: 01Land East of Monreith
page.content: This area contains many ancient sites which are maintained as property of the Department of the Environment. There is a stone circle, cup and ring marked stones, a cross and many earth works and camps with standing stones. The meaning of these early artifacts is little understood at present. The dominering aspect of this area is the Fell of Barhullion, which was obviously a prehistoric defence position, containing both fresh water loch and earthworks. Also on the site is a Triangulation point which is a white stone triangle with holes to facilitate a theodolite for measureing distances and angle accurately also height measurements. Below the fell, most of the land is boggy and the remaining land slightly wooded from olden deciduous woods which probably originally covered much of the area.
